parts.text: You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What is LIU's mission?
LIU's mission is to provide affordable and accessible quality higher education, guiding students to become independent learners who positively impact local and global communities.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
How many campuses does LIU have?
LIU has nine campuses in Lebanon (Beirut, Bekaa, Saida, etc.) and three abroad in Yemen, Senegal, and Mauritania.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What are the core values of LIU?
LIU's core values are Integrity, Excellence, Diversity and Inclusion, Collaboration, Innovation, Compassion, and Stewardship.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
How do I register for courses?
Register via the UMS system during the add/drop period. Ensure prerequisites are met and consult your advisor. Late registration incurs fees.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What is the maximum credit hours per semester?
Undergraduates may take 18–20 credits (max 21 with approval). Summer term allows up to 8 credits.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
Can I withdraw from a course?
Yes, but after the add/drop period, tuition is non-refundable. Exceeding 33.33% absences results in an 'AW' grade.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
How are tuition fees calculated?
Fees are per credit (e.g., $179/credit for Business undergraduates). Additional costs include registration and social security fees.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
Is financial aid available?
Yes, except for Pharmacy students. Maintain a 70% GPA and submit an application to the Students’ Affairs Office.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What is the attendance policy?
Missing >33.33% of a course results in an 'AW' grade. No excuses are accepted for absences.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
How do I apply for a make-up exam?
Submit proof (e.g., hospitalization report) by the Monday after finals. Midterms require dean approval.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What majors are offered in Engineering?
Options include Computer, Electrical, Mechanical, and Industrial Engineering, each requiring 108 credits for a bachelor's degree.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What is the vision of the School of Engineering?
To be a leading institution empowering graduates to address contemporary issues through excellence in teaching and research.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
How do I transfer to LIU?
Submit transcripts, course descriptions, and pay a $30 application fee. Transcripts are evaluated for transferable credits.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What is the Pharmacy program duration?
Undergraduate Pharmacy takes 3 years (179 credits). A PharmD requires 30 additional credits.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What are the admission requirements for Education majors?
Submit a baccalaureate certificate, ID, photo, and pay a $30 fee. TESL and Translation are among the options.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What is the tuition for Freshman programs?
$165 per credit for Freshman Arts/Sciences, with SAT score requirements (2600 for Arts, 2750 for Sciences).
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
Can I take courses at different campuses?
Yes, but ensure a 1-hour gap between courses at different campuses. Registrar approval may be needed.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What is the refund policy?
100% refund during add/drop. No refunds afterward, though petitions are possible. Registration fees are non-refundable.
You are an educational chatbot designed to answer questions and inquiries from students about the Lebanese International University (LIU).
What is the core purpose of the School of Engineering at LIU?

The School of Engineering at LIU is dedicated to laying the foundation for professional careers, equipping students with sophisticated technical and communication skills that make them exceptional in the marketplace.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
Where do LIU engineering graduates typically work?
LIU engineering graduates work in a wide variety of industries located throughout the world, particularly in the Gulf States.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What are some notable qualities of LIU engineering graduates, according to employers?

Employers often describe LIU engineering graduates as flexible and well-known for their exceptional ability to communicate clearly, capability to work through difficult problems, and ability to solve problems and design creatively.

Are undergraduate engineering graduates at LIU encouraged to pursue further education?
Yes, Bachelor's degree graduates are encouraged to join the Master Programs at LIU to enhance their knowledge and prepare them to deal with technical topics and future challenges in practice.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
How does the School of Engineering support its Master's graduates?

The School of Engineering promotes Master's graduates to keep in touch with professors who offer insight and wisdom from practical experience, research, and teaching roles. It is hoped that this cooperation provides opportunities for practical work experience, international study, and community engagement.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What is the mission of the School of Engineering, as stated by the Dean?
The School of Engineering's mission is to train and qualify future engineers for successful careers.

What unifies the faculty, staff, and academicians at the School of Engineering?
All faculty, staff, and academicians are united by a common desire to accomplish the mission of training and qualifying future engineers for successful careers.

How does the School of Engineering contribute to academic excellence?
The School of Engineering fosters research and sustains an active faculty body that promotes excellence.

What kind of development does the School of Engineering integrate into its curricula besides technical and professional development?
In addition to technical and professional development, the School of Engineering integrates ethical education in all curricula.

Who is the Dean of the School of Engineering?
The Dean of the School of Engineering is Amin Haj-Ali, who holds a PhD and MCITPM.

What has been a key focus of the School of Engineering since its early days?

Since its early days, the school has focused on recruiting talented faculty members to run its undergraduate and graduate programs and fostered the sustainable development of excellence in teaching and research.

What has the School of Engineering done to collaborate with other institutions?
Over the years, the school has forged many memorandums of understanding with national, regional, and international institutions to actively collaborate in academic and industrial activities.

What are the results of the School of Engineering's collaborations?
The results of these collaborations include extensive research output, co-supervision of doctoral students, organization of conferences and workshops, and structured internships for students.

How does the School of Engineering ensure its curricula remain competitive?
The school adopts best practices in measuring, maintaining, and enhancing its curricula to provide students with a competitive experience in learning and skills development.

What specific skills and abilities does the SoEN vision aim to provide students with?

The SoEN vision aims to provide students, especially underserved, with the required skills and abilities to succeed as engineers, to become future leaders in their professions, and to be responsible and enlightened citizens.

What is the minimum major and cumulative GPA required for undergraduate graduation?
An undergraduate student must have a major and cumulative GPA of two (70%) and higher to graduate.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What is the minimum major and cumulative GPA required for graduate graduation?
A graduate student must have a major and cumulative GPA of two (70%) and higher to graduate.

What are the first steps for a Lebanese applicant to apply as an undergraduate engineering student at LIU?
Lebanese applicants must prepare a certified copy of their Lebanese Baccalaureate Degree (BACCII) or Technical Baccalaureate degree (BT3) or their equivalence (Foreign Baccalaureate).
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
Is an English proficiency test required for undergraduate applicants at LIU?
Yes, applicants must provide a TOEFL (International IBT) or IELTS score, if available, or must sit for the LIU English Placement Test.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What identification documents are needed for undergraduate applications?
Applicants need 1 copy of their identification card and 1 copy of their family civil status record.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
Are photographs required for undergraduate applications?
Yes, one recent passport-sized colored photograph is required.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What are the social security requirements for Lebanese undergraduate applicants?
All Lebanese applicants must submit their national social security papers (daman), if available, or must pay $135 and fill the appropriate papers at the social security office.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What are the application and entrance exam fees for undergraduate engineering programs?
There are $30 non-refundable application fees and $20 for each Entrance exam.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
Can I apply for financial assistance as an undergraduate student?
Yes, if you are in need of financial assistance, you can pick up an "Application Form for Financial Aid" from the Public Relations Office.

What are the credits required for each undergraduate engineering major?

All listed undergraduate engineering majors, including Electronic Engineering / Emphasis On Biomedical, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Electronics Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Surveying Engineering, Communication Engineering, and Industrial Engineering, require 108 credits.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What is the first step for a non-LIU student applying to a graduate engineering program?
An application must be submitted to the registrar office.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What is the process for a non-LIU student's application file after submission?

The registrar office opens a file, which must include an official transcript mailed by the institution, a certified degree approved from the ministry of higher education, certified identification, and the result of the English Examination. This file is then sent to the School of Engineering for study and a decision within 72 hours.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What happens after the School of Engineering reviews a non-LIU graduate application file?

The School will return the file to the registrar officer with recommendations. The officer will be responsible for changing the major, entering any remedial requirements, and opening a file with the curriculum and acceptance letter, which is then sent back to the school immediately.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What are the credit requirements for all Master's programs in the School of Engineering?

All Master's of Science programs, including Electronic Engineering / Emphasis On Biomedical, Computer and Communication Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Electronics Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Surveying Engineering, and Industrial Engineering, require 52 credits.

What opportunities do LIU's transfer and study abroad programs offer?
LIU's transfer and study abroad programs offer the opportunity to be exposed to a new culture, lifestyle, and different academic experience.

What is a co-requisite course?
A co-requisite is a course that must be registered simultaneously with another specific course.

What is the benefit for international students transferring to LIU?
LIU welcomes all students from around the world to transfer and to have the chance to obtain an American-style education.

How are courses from previous universities handled for transfer students?
All transfer students' transcripts will be reviewed to see which courses may be transferable towards their program of study at LIU.

What are the general requirements for transfer students applying to LIU?

Transfer students need a certified copy of the Lebanese Baccalaureate Degree or its equivalence, a certified copy of the university transcript + course description, identification documents, photographs, national social security papers (if Lebanese), and application/entrance exam fees.

The Lebanese International University (LIU) is a private, non-protfit, independent institution of higher education governed by an autonomous Board of Trustees (Link to BOT).
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
The University was established in 2001 under the name of Bekaa University in accordance with decree 5294 on April 9, 2001.
The University is recognized by the Lebanese State as a private Higher Education Institution in Lebanon, according to the law of Higher Education Organizations in Lebanon.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
The University name was renamed the Lebanese International University, in accordance with decree 14592 on June 14, 2005.

What is the attendance policy?

At LIU, students may miss no more than 33.33% of any course during a regular semester or summer term. Attendance is taken for all class sessions from the first to the last day of classes, and excuses of any nature do NOT eliminate an absence. Students who exceed this limit are automatically given an AW (Academic Withdrawal) grade and will not be allowed to attend class any longer.

How can I apply to LIU?

To apply to LIU as an undergraduate student, you need to prepare these documents:
1. Certified copy of Lebanese Baccalaureate (BACCII) or equivalent
2. TOEFL/IELTS score or take LIU's English Placement Test
3. Copy of ID card
4. Copy of family civil status record
5. Recent passport-sized photo
6. National social security papers (if Lebanese)
7. $30 non-refundable application fee
8. $20 for each entrance exam

You can apply online through the 'Apply Now' link on the LIU website or contact admissions@liu.edu.lb for assistance.

Tell me about the School of Engineering

The School of Engineering at LIU prepares students for professional careers with sophisticated technical and communication skills. The school offers various undergraduate programs including Electronic Engineering with emphasis on Biomedical, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Electronics Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Surveying Engineering, Communication Engineering, and Industrial Engineering. Each program requires 108 credits for graduation.

At the graduate level, the school offers Master's degrees in these same fields, requiring 52 credits. The school's mission is to train and qualify future engineers for successful careers while fostering research and maintaining an active faculty that promotes excellence. For more information, you can contact soe@liu.edu.lb.

What is the grading system at LIU?

LIU uses a quality points (QPTS) grading system:
- 90% or higher = 4.0 QPTS
- 80% = 3.0 QPTS
- 70% = 2.0 QPTS
- 60% = 1.0 QPTS
- Below 60% = 0 QPTS

Undergraduate rating scale:
- 3.91-4.00: Excellent
- 3.28-3.90: Very Good
- 2.64-3.27: Good
- 2.0-2.63: Satisfactory
- Below 2.0: Unsatisfactory

Course status abbreviations include AW (Academic Withdrawal), I (Incomplete), W (Withdrawal), and P/NP (Pass/Not-Pass for remedial courses).

What is the make-up examination policy?

Students are eligible for make-up exams under specific conditions:
1. Sickness (proven by hospitalization report/discharge summary)
2. Death in the family (proven by death certificate and personal identification)
3. Accidents (proven by expert report)

The deadline to submit petitions is the first Monday after the last examination. For mid-term exams, students must appeal directly to their school with approval from the Dean/Associate Dean required. Make-up final exams are scheduled before the start of the next semester, with specific dates for Fall, Spring, and Summer terms.

How do I change my major?

To change your major at LIU:

1. Within the same School: You must meet the requirements for admission to the new major and submit a change of major form from the Registrar's Office. The request is considered by the Department and Dean concerned. After approval, the form is sent to the Registrar's Office for implementation.

2. Moving to another School: You are considered a new student by the new School and must meet its admission requirements. Fill out a change of major form from the Registrar's Office, which will be reviewed by the Department and Dean. After approval, it's sent to the Registrar's Office for implementation.

Tell me about the School of Pharmacy

The School of Pharmacy at LIU offers a Bachelor's degree in Pharmacy requiring 179 credits, typically completed in 3 years. The school also offers a Doctor of Pharmacy (Pharm D) postgraduate degree requiring 30 credits.

The School of Pharmacy's vision is to be a socially accountable institution committed to advancing the pharmacy profession through education, practice, research, and community outreach. Its mission is to develop distinguished professionals in pharmacy practice, research, and community services through a dynamic educational program aligned with national and international standards.

Admissions to the pharmacy program occur once a year, and applicants may apply from May until mid-August for the Pharmacy Entrance Exam. For more information, you can contact sop@liu.edu.lb.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What is the history of LIU?

The Lebanese International University (LIU) was first founded as Bekaa University under Presidential Decree No. 5294 in April 2001, with its first two campuses in Al-Khyara (western Bekaa valley) and Beirut. The name was later changed to Lebanese International University as the founders envisioned making it a national university with presence in all six administrative districts of Lebanon.

Between 2003 and 2013, LIU established seven additional campuses in Lebanon: Saida, Nabatieh, Tripoli, Mount Lebanon, Tyre, Rayak, and Halba-Akkar. Since 2006, LIU expanded internationally, establishing four campuses in Yemen (Sanaa, Aden, and Taiz), one in Mauritania, and one in Senegal.

The university has been under the leadership of Mr. Abdul Rahim Mourad, founder and President, since 2001. LIU's mission focuses on providing access to higher education for first-generation students and democratizing higher education.

What are the application requirements for an undergraduate pharmacy program at LIU?

To apply to LIU as a bachelor student for the pharmacy program, you need to prepare the following documents:
- Certified copy of the Lebanese Baccalaureate Degree (BACCII) or Technical Baccalaureate degree (BT3) or their equivalence (Foreign Baccalaureate).
- TOEFL (International IBT) or IELTS score, if available, or must sit for the LIU English Placement Test.
- 1 copy of the identification card.
- 1 copy of family civil status record.
- 1 recent passport sized colored photograph.
- All Lebanese applicants must submit their national social security papers (daman), if available, or must pay $135 and fill the appropriate papers at the social security office.
- $30 non-refundable application fees.
- $20 for each Entrance exam.

What is the vision of the School of Education?

The vision of the School of Education at the Lebanese International University is to be recognized nationally and internationally as one of the leading schools in promoting 21st-century learner-centered academic excellence for future educators and translators, rigorous research experiences, and community service through initiating diversity, equity, and inclusion. It also aspires to empower its students to become career-oriented lifelong learners and excel in pursuing and sustaining knowledge and innovative digital learning, and provide educational wellbeing for society.

How many credit hours are required for a BA in the School of Education?

The BA in the School of Education requires students to complete 99 credit hours, divided as follows:
- 24 credit hours of General Education Requirements (GER)
- 42 credit hours of Teaching Area Requirements (TAR)
- 33 credit hours of Teacher Education Core Requirement.

The School of Business at LIU has grown significantly and is a leading institution for business programs. It offers up-to-date curricula, preparing graduates who are realistic, practical, eager to learn, and value good citizenship. What is the history of the School of Business?

As one of LIU’s fundamental pillars, the School of Business (SoBU) has evolved with the university’s growth. Since its establishment, the curricula have been adjusted to meet recent market trends. The SoBU has also improved its physical facilities, increased qualified faculty, and adopted systematic procedures to achieve educational excellence, aligning with the Institution’s mission statement. The School of Business constitutes close to one third of LIU’s student population.

What is the vision and mission of the School of Business?

The SoBU Vision is to play an effective role in developing a generation of future business leaders capable of significantly influencing policy, practice, and people. The SoBU Mission is to provide Lebanese and International students with an affirmative and career-focused education, upholding analytical and critical thinking, ethical apprehension, and cultural conscientiousness in expected global business leaders. The school is also committed to delivering high-quality teaching, research, and learning opportunities that combine academic excellence with impact upon business and society, through curricula aligned with the latest trends in Business industries.

What are the graduation requirements for Bachelor of Business Administration programs?

In the Bachelor of Business Administration programs, students must successfully complete a minimum of 99 credit hours, which include: 1-A minimum of 24 credit hours of General Education Required courses. 2-A minimum of 42 credit hours of Core Business Required courses (Minimum 40% of total credit hours requirements) with a minimum GPA of 2.0. 3-A minimum of 33 credit hours of Major Required courses (minimum 25% of total credit hours requirements) with a minimum of 2.00 in both the Major GPA and the Cumulative GPA.

What are the graduation requirements for Master's Degree of Business Administration programs?

In the Master's Degree of Business Administration programs, students holding a Bachelor degree in Business Administration related majors must successfully complete 39 credit hours (500 or above Business courses) as indicated below: 1-A minimum of 21 credit hours of Core Required courses. 2-A minimum of 12 credit hours of Major Required courses. 3-A minimum of 6 credit hours of Major Elective courses. For more details, or for any other inquiries, you can email sob@liu.edu.lb.

What documents are required to apply to LIU as an undergraduate student?

To apply to LIU as a bachelor student, you will need to prepare the following documents: Certified copy of the Lebanese Baccalaureate Degree (BACCII) or Technical Baccalaureate degree (BT3) or their equivalence (Foreign Baccalaureate). TOEFL (International IBT) or IELTS score, if available, or you must sit for the LIU English Placement Test. 1 copy of the identification card. 1 copy of family civil status record. 1 recent passport sized colored photograph. All Lebanese applicants must submit their national social security papers (daman), if available, or must pay $135 and fill the appropriate papers at the social security office. $30 non-refundable application fees. $20 for each Entrance exam. If you are in need of financial assistance, you can pick up an "Application Form for Financial Aid" from the Public Relations Office.

What are the admission requirements for the freshman program?

To complete the freshman program, each student must complete at least 30 credits in Freshman Arts, Freshman Sciences, or Freshman Engineering. Students must also complete the SAT I and SAT II to receive accreditation by the Ministry of Education. The Admissions Office combines SAT I and SAT II quality points for evaluation. The minimum required scores for Freshman Arts are SAT I and SAT II combined score of 2600, and for Freshman Sciences/Engineering are 2750. Additionally, a certified copy of the Freshman permission from the Lebanese Ministry of Higher Education, certified copies of grades 10-11-and 12, copies of identification and family civil status records, a recent passport-sized colored photograph, and a non-refundable application fee of $30 and an English entrance exam fee of $20 are required.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
How can I apply for financial aid at LIU?

Students may apply for financial aid by filling out an application form obtained from the Students’ Affairs Office (SAO). Upon obtaining the application, students should schedule an interview with a Financial Aid Officer (FAO) at the SAO and submit the complete form with appropriate documents before the official deadline. Dates and deadlines are updated on the LIU website and academic year calendar. The application deadline is the end of the 5th week of an academic semester. Financial Aid applications must be renewed every academic year by filling a 'Renewal Form' from the SAO. The Financial Aid Committee reviews each application carefully and makes the appropriate decision.
